question: Can I afford a home costing $250,000 with an annual income of $75,000 and a 720 credit score?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 720 and DTI 28%, you can afford a $250,000 home. Down payment is typically 5-20%.

steps.content: Can I afford a home costing $250,000 with an annual income of $75,000 and a 720 credit score?
Plan: 1) Consult home_loan_agent for affordability analysis. 2) Verify credit score with credit_agent. 3) Use calculator for DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide answer.
Retrieving knowledge on home affordability guidelines.
General guideline: Home cost should not exceed 3-5 times annual income. Check DTI and credit score.
Verifying credit score: 720 is excellent, above typical requirements.
Credit score of 720 is well above minimum requirements for most loans.
Calculating debt-to-income (DTI) ratio assuming monthly debts of $500.
DTI calculated as 28%, which is within acceptable limits for home loans.
Retrieving knowledge on down payment requirements.
Down payment typically ranges from 5-20% depending on loan type and lender.
Review complete, all checks are satisfactory.
Yes, with a credit score of 720 and DTI 28%, you can afford a $250,000 home. Down payment is typically 5-20%.
